intro: Vitex longisepala, commonly known as the long-sepaled chaste tree, is a tropical shrub or small tree native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its opposite, ovate to elliptic leaves that are usually hairy on the underside. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers in clusters, typically in shades of white or purple, followed by woody, egg-shaped fruits. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas or disturbed sites. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal uses, it is sometimes cultivated in horticulture.
